translation: If this is accomplished, you'll be recruited again.'

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：『今我無見，此事云何？』
translation: The brāhmaṇa said, 'Now that I have no vision, what about this?'

source_sentence: 王重勸勉：『我當遣人將護汝往。』
translation: The king repeated his encouragement, 'I will send someone to escort you there.'

source_sentence: 即給道糧行道所須，引路而去。
translation: He then gave them the provisions they needed to travel on the path and led them away.

source_sentence: 「時快目王國，種種災怪悉皆興現。
translation: "At the time, various calamities and monsters were manifested in the kingdom of Pleasant Eye.

source_sentence: 空中崩聲，曳電星落，陰霧霹靂，地處處裂，飛鳥之類，悲鳴感切，挫戾其身，自拔羽翼，虎狼師子走獸之屬，鳴吼人間，宛轉于地。
translation: The sky crumbles, lightning bolts fall, clouds and mists thunder, the ground splits open everywhere, birds of prey cry out in pity and are moved to pluck their bodies and wings, and tigers, wolves, lions, and wild animals roar among the people and wander the earth.

source_sentence: 國王臣民，怪其所以。
translation: The king and his subjects wondered why.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門，漸到大城，徑至殿前，高聲唱言：『我在他國，承王名德，一切布施，不逆人意，故涉遠來，欲望乞匃。』
translation: The Brāhmaṇa then gradually reached the large city, went straight to the palace, and called out in a loud voice, saying, 'I was in another country, and I've received the king's name and virtue, and I don't disagree with people's wishes when I give generosity.

source_sentence: 王聞是語，即下問訊：『步涉遐道，得無疲倦？
translation: Hearing these words, the king then descended and asked, 'How can you travel a long way without becoming weary?'

source_sentence: 若欲所得，一切所須，國土珍寶，車馬輦輿，衣被飲食，隨病醫藥，一切所須，皆當給與。』
translation: If there's anything you want, everything you need, such as treasures of the land, chariots, horses, mounts, clothing, food, and medicines for illnesses, you will give them all that's needed.'

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：『外物布施，福德不妙，內身布施，果報乃大。
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, 'Giving external things doesn't have wonderful merit, but giving internally will have great rewards.

source_sentence: 我久失眼，長夜處冥，承聞大王，故發意來，欲乞王眼。』
translation: For a long time, I was blind and spent a long night in darkness, but I heard about you, great king, so I had the intention to come here and ask for the king's eyes.'

source_sentence: 王聞歡喜，語婆羅門：『若欲得眼，我當相與。』
translation: Rejoicing at what he heard, the king said to the Brāhmaṇa, 'If you want to get eyes, I'll give them to you.'

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：『欲與我者，何時能與？』
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, 'When can I give them to you if you want to give them to me?'

source_sentence: 王語之曰：『却後七日，便當與汝。』
translation: The king said to him, 'Seven days after I leave, I'll give it to you.'

source_sentence: 王即宣下八萬四千小國：『須提羅王，却後七日，當剜其目施婆羅門。
translation: The king then declared to the 84,000 small states, 'King Sudhira, seven days after you leave, you will pluck out your eyes and give them to the brāhmaṇas.

source_sentence: 諸欲來者，悉皆時集。』
translation: All those who wish to come will gather there at that time.'

source_sentence: 諸王人民聞斯令已，普來奔詣於大王所。
translation: After the kings and their people heard this order, they all rushed to the great king's office.

source_sentence: 八萬四千諸王臣民，以身投地，腹拍王前，啼淚交流，而白王言：『我之等類，閻浮提人，蒙賴大王，以為蔭覆。
translation: Eighty-four thousand of the king's subjects threw themselves to the ground, beat their bellies against the king's face, wept, and exchanged tears as they said to the king, 'My kind, the people of Jambudvīpa, are indebted to the great king for their overshadowing.

source_sentence: 若當剜眼施婆羅門，一切人民，當何恃怙？
translation: If we were to pluck out our eyes and give them to the Brāhmaṇas, what would all the people rely on?'

source_sentence: 唯願迴意，勿為一人而捨一切。』
translation: Please change your mind, and don't sacrifice everything for one person.'

source_sentence: 一萬大臣亦皆投地，仰白王言：『何不哀愍憐我曹等？
translation: Ten thousand ministers also threw themselves to the ground and looked up to the king, saying, 'Why don't you have compassion on us, Cao and the others?'

source_sentence: 為一人意，捨棄我等。
translation: For the sake of one person's mind, he abandoned us.

source_sentence: 唯願迴意，莫與其眼。』
translation: Please change your mind and don't give it to your eyes.'

source_sentence: 二萬夫人，頭腦打地，腹拍王前，亦皆求請：『唯願大王！
translation: Twenty thousand wives beat their heads to the ground, slapped their bellies in front of the king, and all pleaded, 'Please, Great King!'

source_sentence: 迴意易志，莫以眼施，安慰我等。』
translation: Please don't comfort us by giving us your eyes.'

source_sentence: 五百太子，涕哭王前：『唯願天父！
translation: Five hundred princes wept before the king, saying, 'Please, Father!

source_sentence: 當具矜憐莫以眼施，撫養我等。』
translation: Have compassion for us, and don't give us gifts from your eyes.'

source_sentence: 時戒賢太子，重白王言：『願剜我眼，以代父王。
translation: The prince of Precepts then repeatedly said to the king, 'May I have my eyes plucked out to replace my father.'

source_sentence: 所以然者？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我雖身死，國無損益；大王無眼，海內靡恃。』
translation: Although I die, my kingdom has no loss; the king has no eyes, and the sea has no support.'

source_sentence: 時快目王，告諸王臣夫人太子：『我受身來，生死長久，設積身骨，高於須彌；斬刺之血，倍於四海；而飲母乳，過四大江；別離悲淚，多於四海。
translation: Then King Quick Eyes addressed the king's ministers, ladies, and princes, saying, 'Since I was born, I've been born and died for a long time, so I've accumulated bones taller than Sumeru, been cut and stabbed for blood twice as high as the four seas, drank milk that exceeded the four large rivers, and had more tears of sorrow for separation than the four seas.

source_sentence: 地獄之中，破壞之身，燒煮斫刺，棄眼無數。
translation: In hell, their bodies are destroyed, burned, chopped, and stabbed, and their eyes are discarded countless times.

source_sentence: 餓鬼之中，受若干形，火從身出，還自焦然，如是破壞，眼亦無數。
translation: Among hungry ghosts, they're subjected to certain forms, and fire comes out of their bodies, scorching them back, and thus destroying their eyes, which are countless.

source_sentence: 畜生之中，更相食噉，種種死傷，復不可計。
translation: Among animals, they are further eaten and gnawed, and their various deaths and injuries are incalculable.

source_sentence: 人間受身，壽多中夭，或爭色欲，還相圖謀，共相傷殺，死非一徹。
translation: Among humans, many of the bodies they receive live to a ripe old age, or they compete for sex and desire, and they plot against each other, killing each other, and dying is not uniform.

source_sentence: 如是破散，無央數眼，正使生天，命亦不久。
translation: Thus, they are destroyed and scattered, and their eyes are countless; even if they were to be born in heaven, their lives wouldn't be long.

source_sentence: 計本以來，亦受多形，於此三界，迴波五道，為貪恚癡，碎身塵數，未曾給施用求佛道。
translation: Counting back to the past, they've also suffered many forms, spent time in the three realms, wandered around the five destinies, and been made to suffer from craving, ill-will, and delusion, shattering their bodies into numerous dust motes, never bestowing gifts or seeking the Buddha Way.

source_sentence: 如此臭眼，危脆之物，如是不久，自當爛壞；今得用施，不應不與。
translation: Such a stinky eye, a dangerous and fragile thing, will surely rot in the near future; now that it can be used for charity, it shouldn't be withheld.

source_sentence: 今持此眼，以用布施求佛無上一切智眼。
translation: Now, I'll take this eye and use it to give alms to seek the Buddha's unsurpassed all-seeing eye.

source_sentence: 若我願成，當與汝等，清淨慧眼。
translation: If I fulfill my vow, I will give you all the eye of pure wisdom.

source_sentence: 汝莫遮我無上道意。』
translation: Don't obstruct my intention for the unsurpassed path.'

source_sentence: 其在會者，默然無言。
translation: Those present at the meeting remained silent.

source_sentence: 正語左右：『可挑我眼。』
translation: He said to his right and left, 'You can pick my eyes.'

source_sentence: 左右諸臣，咸各言曰：『寧破我身，猶如芥子，不能舉手向大王眼。』
translation: The ministers to his left and right each said, 'I'd rather refute my body than be like a mustard seed that can't raise its hand to the great king's eye.'

source_sentence: 王語諸臣：『汝等推覓其色正黑諦下視者，便召將來。』
translation: The king said to the ministers, 'Search for someone whose color is perfectly black and who looks down with an honest-to-goodness truth, and then summon them to him.'

source_sentence: 諸臣求得，將來與王。
translation: The ministers asked for it and brought it to the king.

source_sentence: 王即授刀，勅語令剜。
translation: The king then gave them a sword and ordered them to pluck out the eye with a command.

source_sentence: 剜得一眼，著王掌中，王便立誓：『我以此眼，以用布施，誓求佛道。
translation: When he plucked out one eye and put it in the king's palm, the king made a vow, 'With this eye, I'll use it to give alms and vow to pursue the Buddha's path.

source_sentence: 若審當得成佛道者，此婆羅門，得我此眼，即當用視。』
translation: If I were to examine someone who would attain the Buddha Way, this Brāhmaṇa who has this eye of mine would then use it to look at them.'

source_sentence: 作是誓已，王即以眼，安婆羅門眼匡之中，尋得用見，得視王身及餘眾會，歡喜踊躍，不能自勝，即白王言：『得王一眼，足我用視，願留一眼，王自用看。』
translation: After making this vow, the king then placed his eye in the Brahmin's eye socket, found a useful view, and was overcome with joy and excitement as he looked at the king's body and the rest of the assembly.

source_sentence: 王復答言：『我已言決，許與兩眼，不應違言。』
translation: The king then answered, 'I've made up my mind to give him both eyes, so don't disobey me.'

source_sentence: 便更剜一眼，復著掌中，重復立誓：『我持眼施，用求佛道。
translation: He then plucked out one more eye, put it back in his palm, and repeated his vow, 'I'll give this gift of an eye to seek the Buddha's path.

source_sentence: 審能成佛，至誠不虛，此婆羅門，得於我眼，便當用視。』
translation: I'm sure I can become a buddha, and my sincerity isn't false; this Brāhmaṇa will then use his eyes to look at me.'

source_sentence: 復安一眼，尋得用視。
translation: Again, he took one look and found a way to use it.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，天地震動，諸天宮殿，皆亦動搖，時諸天人，愕然驚懼，尋見菩薩剜目布施，咸皆飛來，側塞虛空，散諸華香而用供養，讚言：『善哉！
translation: At the time, the heavens shook and the palaces of the gods were shaken, and the gods and humans were startled and frightened when they saw the bodhisattva plucking out his eyes and giving alms to them, and they all flew up, crowded the sky, spread flowers and incense, made offerings, and praised him, saying, 'Good!

source_sentence: 大王所作，甚奇甚特！』
translation: What the great king has done is very strange and extraordinary!'

source_sentence: 天帝前問：『實為奇特！
translation: The emperor went ahead and asked, 'How marvelous indeed!

source_sentence: 能作是事，欲求何報？』
translation: What reward do you seek if you can do this?'

source_sentence: 王答言曰：『不求魔梵四王帝釋轉輪聖王三界之樂，以此功德，誓求佛道，度脫眾生，至涅槃樂。』
translation: The king answered, 'I don't seek the happiness of the three realms of the four Māra and Brahmā kings, the wheel-turning sage king, but this merit vows to pursue the Buddha's path, liberate sentient beings, and reach the bliss of nirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: 天帝復問：『汝今剜眼，苦痛如是，頗有悔退瞋恚不耶？』
translation: Again, Indra asked, 'Now that you've had your eye plucked out and it's been so painful, won't you repent and withdraw your anger?'

source_sentence: 王言不悔，亦不瞋恨。
translation: The king said he wasn't sorry and didn't hold a grudge.

source_sentence: 天帝復言：『我今觀汝，血出流離，形體戰掉，言不悔恨，此事難信。』
translation: Again, Indra said, 'Now, when I look at you, your blood is spilled, and your body is fighting and falling apart, and you say you don't regret it, it's hard to believe.'

source_sentence: 王即自誓：『我剜眼施，無悔恨意，用求佛道，會當得成。
translation: The king then vowed to himself, 'I'll pluck out my eyes and give them as alms without remorse, and I'll use them to pursue the Buddha Way, which will be accomplished.

source_sentence: 審不虛者，令我兩眼平復如故。』
translation: Those whose judgment isn't false will make my eyes stand straight as before.'

source_sentence: 王誓已訖，兩眼平完，明淨徹視，倍勝於前。
translation: After he finished his vow, the king's eyes were even and complete, and his vision was clear and penetrating, twice as good as before.

source_sentence: 諸天人民，一切大會，稱慶喜踊，不能自勝。
translation: The gods and people of the whole assembly rejoiced and were overwhelmed with joy.

source_sentence: 王語婆羅門：『今與汝眼，令汝得視，後成佛時，復當令汝得慧眼見。』
translation: The king said to the Brāhmaṇa, 'Now, I've given you eyes to enable you to see, and when you later become a buddha, I'll again give you the vision of wisdom.'

source_sentence: 將婆羅門，入寶藏中，恣取一擔，發遣去。
translation: He took the Brāhmaṇa into his treasure house, took a pile of it at random, and sent it away.

source_sentence: 還到本國，波羅陀跋彌，自出迎之，已見先問：『得眼不耶？』
translation: When he returned to his native land, he was greeted by Prātimokṣa, who first asked, 'Have you attained the eye?'

source_sentence: 答言：『得眼，我今用視。』
translation: He answered, 'I've got the eye, and now I'm using it to see.'

source_sentence: 復問言曰：『彼王今者，為存為亡？』
translation: Again, he asked, 'Does that king now exist or does he die?'

source_sentence: 答言：『諸天來下，尋即誓願，眼還平復，眼好於前。』
translation: He replied, 'Coming down from the gods, I immediately vowed that my eyes would be restored and that I would have good eyes.'

source_sentence: 波羅陀跋彌，以聞此語，惱悶憤結，心裂而死。」
translation: Upon hearing this, Bhadrapāṇi was so distressed and angered that his heart broke open and he died."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「欲知爾時須提羅王，今我身是。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "You want to know what King Sudhira was at the time, and what I am now.

source_sentence: 波羅陀跋彌，今調達是。
translation: This is Bhaddāli and Bhadrapāla, the present-day adept.

source_sentence: 時乞我眼婆羅門者，今此會中，盲婆羅門得道者是。
translation: The one who begged me for eyesight was the blind brāhmaṇa who attained the Way in this assembly.

source_sentence: 先世之時，我與其眼，乃至今日，由見我故，既得肉眼，復得慧眼。
translation: In a prior life, I gave him eyes, and now, because of seeing me, he's attained the physical eye and also the eye of wisdom.

source_sentence: 我為汝曹，世世苦行，積功累德，今日致佛，汝等應當勤求出要。」
translation: I've worked hard for you people throughout the ages to accumulate the merit that will lead to the Buddha today, so you should diligently seek to escape the essentials."

source_sentence: 佛說是語，時諸在會者，感念佛恩，內身克厲，有得須陀洹、斯陀含、阿那含、阿羅漢者，有發無上道意者。
translation: When the Buddha spoke these words, those present at the meeting were so grateful for the Buddha's kindness that they did an internal act of self-restraint, some attaining stream entry, once-returner, non-returner, arhat, and some arousing the intention for the unsurpassed path.

source_sentence: 賢者阿難，及諸會者，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Good man Ānanda and the assembled people who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （三三）五百盲兒往返逐佛緣品第二十八
translation: (33) Chapter 28 of Five Hundred Blind Children Traveling Back and Forth to Catch the Buddha's Reasons

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛住舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時毘舍離國，有五百盲人，乞匃自活，時聞人言：「如來出世，甚奇甚特，其有眾生覩見之者，癃殘百病，皆蒙除愈，盲視聾聽，瘂語僂伸，拘躄手足，狂亂得正，貧施衣食，愁憂苦厄，悉能解免。」
translation: At the time, there were 500 blind people in Vaiśālī who were begging for food to feed themselves, and they heard someone say, "The Tathāgata comes into the world, and it's so rare and extraordinary that when sentient beings see him, their debilitating illnesses are all healed, they're blind and deaf, dumb and deaf, speechless, hand and footless, frantic, and able to correct themselves, and they're given poor clothing and food, and their grief and suffering are all relieved."

source_sentence: 時諸盲人聞此語已，還共議言：「我曹罪積，苦毒特兼，若當遇佛，必見救濟。」
translation: After hearing these words, the blind men returned and said together, "We have accumulated so many sins and have suffered so much, if we were to meet the Buddha, we would surely see relief."

source_sentence: 便問人言：「世尊今者，為在何國？」
translation: They then asked the others, "Where is the Bhagavān now?"

source_sentence: 人報之曰：「在舍衛國。」
translation: They were told, "They're in Śrāvastī."

source_sentence: 聞此語已，共於路側，卑言求哀：「誰有慈悲，愍我等者？
translation: After hearing this, they all went out on the side of the road and begged in humble terms, "Who has compassion for us?

source_sentence: 願見將導，到舍衛國，至於佛所！」
translation: May I see the general guide you to Śrāvastī and reach the Buddha!"

source_sentence: 喚倩經時，無有應者。
translation: When they were called to reveal the sūtras, there was no answer.

source_sentence: 時五百人，復共議曰：「空手倩人，人無應者，今共行乞，人各令得金錢一枚，以用雇人，足得達彼。」
translation: Five hundred people then again agreed, "They didn't respond to my call, so now we'll each beg for a coin to hire, which will be enough to reach them."

source_sentence: 各各行乞，經于數時，人獲一錢，凡有五百，合錢已竟，左右喚人：「誰將我等，到舍衛者，金錢五百，雇其勞苦。」
translation: After going begging for a few hours, each person received one coin, or five hundred. When they had finished combining the coins, they called out to the others, "Who will take us to Śrāvastī for five hundred coins to hire them for their trouble?"

source_sentence: 時有一人，來共相可，相可已定，以錢與之。
translation: A man then came to us and gave us the money after we had agreed to meet him.

source_sentence: 勅諸盲人，展轉相牽，自在前導，將至摩竭國，棄諸盲人，置於澤中。
translation: He led the blind men from hand to hand, took them by themselves, and led them to the country of Maghreb, where he abandoned them and put them in a swamp.

source_sentence: 是時盲人，不知所在，為是何國？
translation: The blind men then didn't know where they were or what country it was.

source_sentence: 互相捉手，經行他田，傷破苗穀。
translation: They grabbed each other's hands and went through other fields, injuring and destroying the seedlings.

source_sentence: 時有長者，值來行田，見五百人，踐蹋苗稼，傷壞甚多，瞋憤怒盛，勅與痛手。
translation: An elder who was walking through his field saw 500 people trampling on the crops and damaging many of them, and he became angry and riled up and ordered them to give him a painful hand.

source_sentence: 乞兒求哀，具宣上事，長者愍之，令一使人將詣舍衛。
translation: The beggar begged for mercy and explained the above, but the elder was sympathetic and ordered an envoy to bring him to Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 適達彼國，又聞世尊，已復來向，摩竭提國。
translation: When he arrived there, he heard that the Bhagavān had returned to Magadhā.

source_sentence: 是時使人，復還將來向摩竭國。
translation: The messenger then returned and headed for the country of Magadha.

source_sentence: 時諸盲人，欽仰於佛，係心欲見，肉眼雖閉，心眼已覩，歡喜發中，不覺疲勞。
translation: The blind men then looked up to the Buddha, longing to see him with their minds, and although their physical eyes were closed, their mental eyes had already seen him, and they rejoiced and aroused, not feeling fatigued.

source_sentence: 已至摩竭，復聞世尊，已還舍衛。
translation: Once they reached Maghā, they heard again that the Bhagavān had returned to Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 如是追逐，凡經七返。
translation: He chased after them like this for seven rounds.

source_sentence: 爾時如來觀諸盲人，善根已熟，敬信純固，於舍衛國，便住待之。
translation: Observing the blind men, the Tathāgata saw that their good roots were ripened and their respect and faith were pure, so he stayed in Śrāvastī and waited for them.

source_sentence: 使將盲人，漸到佛所。
translation: He led the blind men gradually to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛光觸身，驚喜無量，即時兩目，即得開明，乃見如來，四眾圍遶，身色晃昱，如紫金山，感戴殊澤，喜不自勝。
translation: They were startled and delighted beyond measure when the Buddha's light touched their bodies, and immediately their two eyes were opened, and they saw the Tathāgata surrounded by four people, his body shining like a purple gold mountain, and they were overcome with joy as they were showered with extraordinary splendor.

source_sentence: 前詣佛所，五體投地，為佛作禮，作禮畢訖，異口同音，共白佛言：「唯願垂矜，聽在道次。」
translation: He went to the Buddha, threw himself five times to the ground, paid homage to him, and when he had finished paying homage, he spoke with one voice and said to the Buddha, "Please grant us permission to listen to you in the order of the [Buddha's] path."

source_sentence: 時佛告白：「善來比丘！」
translation: The Buddha then addressed them, saying, "Well done, monks!"

source_sentence: 鬚髮自墮，法衣在身，重為說法，得阿羅漢。
translation: With his beard and hair falling out, he put on the Dharma robe, repeatedly taught the Dharma, and became an arhat.

source_sentence: 爾時阿難，見諸盲人，肉眼明淨，又盡諸漏，成阿羅漢，長跪合掌，前白佛言：「世尊出世，實復奇特，所為善事，不可思議。
translation: It was then that Ānanda, seeing all the blind people whose physical eyes were clear and whose contaminants had been ended and who had become arhats, knelt down long and joined his palms as he said to the Buddha, "The Bhagavān's appearance in the world is truly remarkable, and the good deeds he's done are unfathomable.

source_sentence: 又此諸盲人，特蒙殊澤，肉眼既明，復獲慧眼，世尊出世，正為此等。」
translation: These blind people have been especially blessed, and once their physical eyes are clear, they've also gained the eye of wisdom; this is precisely the kind of thing that makes the Bhagavān appear in the world."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「我非但今日，除其冥闇，乃往久遠，無量劫時，亦為此等除大黑闇。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Not only have I removed their darkness today, but I've also removed great darkness for them in long ago, during an incalculably long time."

source_sentence: 阿難白佛：「不審，世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "I don't think so, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 過去世中，為此除闇，其事云何？」
translation: What was the purpose of removing this darkness in a past life?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「乃昔久遠，無量無數阿僧祇劫，此閻浮提，五百賈客，共行曠野，經由嶮路，大山谷中，極為黑闇。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Once upon a time, long ago, in an incalculably long incalculable eon, there were five hundred merchants in this Jambudvīpa who traveled together through a dangerous road, a large valley, and extreme darkness in the wilderness.

source_sentence: 時諸商人，迷悶愁憂，恐失財物，此處多賊，而復怖畏，咸共同心，向于天地日月山海一切神祇，啼哭求哀。
translation: The merchants were so confused and distressed that they feared losing their possessions, and this place was full of thieves, and they were so frightened that they all joined together in one mind and cried out to all the gods of heaven and earth, the sun, moon, mountains, and seas for mercy.

source_sentence: 時薩薄主，愍諸商客迷悶之苦，便告言曰：『汝等莫怖！
translation: Pitying the merchants' distress, Lord Sapta then addressed them, saying, 'Don't be afraid!

source_sentence: 各自安意，吾當為汝作大照明。』
translation: Settle down, and I will be a great light for you.'

source_sentence: 是時薩簿，即以白[疊*毛]，自纏兩臂，酥油灌之，然用當炬，將諸商人，經於七日，乃越此闇。
translation: The saṃsāra then wrapped a white [tuft of *hair] around his own two arms, rubbed it with ghee, and used it as a torch to bring the merchants out of the darkness after seven days.

source_sentence: 時諸賈客感戴其恩，慈敬無量，各獲安隱，喜不自勝。」
translation: The merchants then were so grateful for his kindness and immeasurable respect that they each attained peace and were overjoyed."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「爾時薩薄，豈異人乎？
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "At that point, is Sapha different from anyone else?

source_sentence: 我身是也。
translation: "This is my body.

source_sentence: 我從昔來，國城妻子，及以肉血，恒施眾生，以是之故，今致特尊。
translation: Since the distant past, I've always given my country, my wife, and my flesh and blood to sentient beings, and because of that, I've become especially venerable.

source_sentence: 爾時五百諸賈客者，豈異人乎？
translation: At the time, were those five hundred guests different people?

source_sentence: 今此五百比丘是也。
translation: These are the five hundred monks here.

source_sentence: 過去世時，以生死力，施其光明，今得成佛，亦施無漏慧眼。」
translation: In a past life, they used the power of birth and death to give their light, and now that they've become buddhas, they've also given their untainted wisdom eye."

source_sentence: 爾時眾會，聞佛所說，有得須陀洹、斯陀含、阿那含、阿羅漢，有種辟支佛善根，或發無上道意度者甚多。
translation: At the time, there were many assemblies that heard what the Buddha taught, including those who had attained stream entry, once-returner, non-returner, arhat, and those with the good roots of a pratyekabuddha, or who had awakened the intention to save the world on the unsurpassed path.

source_sentence: 慧命阿難，及諸眾會，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Wise Life Ānanda and the congregation who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （三四）富那奇緣品第二十九
translation: (34) Chapter 29 of Funa's Strange Conditions

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時放鉢國，有一長者，名曇摩羨(此言法軍)，於彼國中，巨富第一。
translation: At the time, there was an elder named Dharmasena (this word means army of the Dharma) in the country of Bombay, who was the wealthiest among them all.

source_sentence: 時長者妻，生一男兒，值出軍征伐餘國，因字其兒，號曰羨那(此言軍也)；後復生兒，值王出軍征討得勝，復字其兒比耆陀羨那(此言勝軍)。
translation: When the elder's wife gave birth to a son, she called him Sena (this word means army) because she had gone out to conquer another country; later, she gave birth to another son, and when the king went out to conquer and won, he called his son Sena (this word means victorious army).

source_sentence: 二子長大，各為娶妻。
translation: When the two sons grew up, each of them took a wife.

source_sentence: 爾時長者，遇疾困篤，數召諸醫，瞻養其病，看視醫師，甘饍盡供。
translation: When the elder became ill and distressed, he summoned several doctors to nurse his illness, visit the doctors, and offer them all delicious foods.

source_sentence: 醫貪利養，欲遣殘病，逆懷姦詐，更與餘藥，使病不瘥。
translation: The doctors were greedy for profit and wanted to get rid of the residual illness, so they cheated and gave him more medicine, causing the illness not to heal.

source_sentence: 時有一婢，供養長者，飲食湯藥，恒知時宜，白長者言：「從今以去，此諸醫師，不足更喚，惡意相誤，病更不瘥。
translation: A servant supported the elder, providing him with food and medicine, always knowing the proper times, and saying to him, "From now on, these doctors aren't enough to call on again, and they maliciously misunderstand each other, so their illnesses don't get cured.

source_sentence: 今我自當，如前法度，隨病所須，更莫喚醫。」
translation: Now, I myself will follow the previous rules and never call a doctor again, just as the illness requires."

source_sentence: 婢便看養，長者得瘥。
translation: The maid then nursed the elder, and he recovered.

source_sentence: 於是其婢，白長者言：「大家！
translation: The maid then said to the elder, "Sir!

source_sentence: 我看大家，瞻視供養，病得除瘥，唯當垂愍賜我一願。」
translation: I've seen you all, watched over you, made offerings, and gotten over my illness; please have mercy on me and grant me one vow."

source_sentence: 長者告曰：「卿求何等？」
translation: The elder told him, "What do you seek?"

source_sentence: 時婢便言：「欲得大家與我共通，若不見違當從我志。」
translation: The maid then said, "I want you to share this with me, and if you don't see anything contrary, you must obey my wish."

source_sentence: 長者不逆，即遂其願。
translation: The elder didn't object, so he granted her wish.

source_sentence: 交通已竟，便覺有身。
translation: After he finished communicating with her, she then realized that she was pregnant.

source_sentence: 時婢懷妊，十月已滿，生一男兒，其願滿足，故因字其兒，名富那奇(此言滿願)。
translation: When she was pregnant, she gave birth to a boy after the tenth month had passed, and her vow was fulfilled, so she gave birth to a son named Pūrṇa Ki (this word fulfills a vow).

source_sentence: 端正福德，宜於錢財，善能估販，種種治生，倍獲盈利，所至到處，無有不吉。
translation: He was well endowed with good fortune, adept with money and possessions, a good appraiser of goods, and able to make a profit by taming various livelihoods, and there was no place he went that wasn't fortunate.

source_sentence: 雖復稟受長者遺體，才藝智量，出過人表，然是廝賤婢使所生，不及兒次，名在奴例。
translation: Although he then inherited the remains of an elder and surpassed others in ability, skill, and wisdom, he was born to a lowly servant, not as good as a son, and was called a slave.

source_sentence: 爾時長者，復嬰痼疾，困篤著床，將死不久，遺言慇懃，告其二子：「吾設沒後，慎勿分居。」
translation: At the time, the elder was chronically ill, confined to his bed, and about to die, and his last words were kind, telling his two sons, "After I die, be careful not to live apart."

source_sentence: 長者被病，雖服醫藥，不能救濟，奄致命終。
translation: The elder was sick, and although he took medicine, it couldn't help him, and he was dying.

source_sentence: 爾時二子，承用父教，共居一處，經歷年戴。
translation: At the time, his two sons, in accordance with their father's teaching, lived together in the same place for years.

source_sentence: 值時有緣，欲至他國賈作治生，各以家居婦兒，付囑富那奇：「為我看視斯等大小，及家餘事。」
translation: When there were conditions that made them want to go to another country and work as healers, they each gave a family member a wife and child and instructed Pūrṇacī, "Look after these children and the rest of the family for me."

source_sentence: 悉用相累，正爾別去。
translation: They were all burdened by each other, and they correctly departed.

source_sentence: 於時富那奇，即受其教，營理家事。
translation: Pūrṇa Ki then accepted his teaching and managed the household affairs.

source_sentence: 時二兄子，數往其所，求索飲食及餘所須，時富那奇，稱給其意，隨其所求，買索與之。
translation: When two older sons went to him several times, asking for food and drink and whatever else they needed, Pūrṇa Ki gave them what they wanted and bought and gave them whatever they asked for.

source_sentence: 卒值一日無錢持行，勝軍小兒白富那奇：「我今飢渴，與我飲食。」
translation: One day, when he had no money to carry on his journey, the victorious army's younger son said to Pūrṇaçi, "Now that I'm hungry and thirsty, give me something to eat."

source_sentence: 手中無錢，索食叵得。
translation: Having no money in his hand, he couldn't obtain the food he asked for.

source_sentence: 小兒瞋恚，往語其母：「今富那奇，懷情不普，見伯父兒，隨意給稱，我從索食，獨不見與。」
translation: Angry, the boy went to his mother and said, "Now, Funachai's sentiments aren't universal; when he sees his uncle's son, he gives him whatever he wants, and I ask for food, but he doesn't give it to him."

source_sentence: 母聞兒言恨心便生，云此婢子，敢懷偏心。
translation: When she heard what he said, her mother's hatred arose, saying, 'How dare this servant boy harbor biased thoughts?'

source_sentence: 勝軍還家，其婦及兒忿心未息，具以上事，向勝軍說。
translation: When Jun returned home, the woman and her son's anger hadn't yet subsided, so they told Jun about the above incident.

source_sentence: 勝軍聞之倍懷憤怒：「此婢子奴，敢違我教，薄賤我兒，吾當殺之。」
translation: When she heard this, she was doubly enraged, "This servant dares to disobey my teaching and despise my son; I will kill him."

source_sentence: 懷情已定，求兄分居。
translation: Now that his mind was made up, he asked his brother to separate from him.

source_sentence: 兄敬父勅，即時不可。
translation: He respected his father's command and immediately refused.

source_sentence: 勝軍懊惱，數求不止。
translation: She was distressed and repeatedly asked for more.

source_sentence: 兄見意盛，察其所規，知弟懷恚，意不得已，即可其言：「聽各分居，弟以家財，一切所有，養生園宅，用作一分，以富那奇，用作一分，以此二分，恣兄取之。」
translation: Seeing his intentions and observing his rules, he knew that his younger brother was angry and had no choice but to ask him, "Let's listen to your request for a separation; I'll use my family's wealth and everything I own, including my living quarters and mansion, for one part, and my wealthy family's home for one part.

source_sentence: 謂兄取財，規自取富那奇，而欲殺之。
translation: He said, 'My brother will take the property, and he's supposed to take Funachi himself, intending to kill him.'

source_sentence: 兄知勝軍心害富那奇，慈心憐愍，取富那奇，空將妻子，單罄來出，依餘家住。
translation: Knowing that VICTOR's intentions were to harm Pūrṇacī, the older brother had compassion on him, took Pūrṇacī, left his wife alone, and went to live with the rest of the family.

source_sentence: 時富那奇，問其嫂曰：「與我少錢，欲用買薪。」
translation: Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra then asked his sister-in-law, "Give me a little money, and I want to buy some firewood."

source_sentence: 兄嫂答曰：「唯有五錢。」
translation: His brother and sister-in-law replied, "There's only five coins."

source_sentence: 即解用與。
translation: They then gave it to him.

source_sentence: 時富那奇，持此五錢，詣市買薪，見一束薪賣索五錢，時富那奇，即買其薪，雇以五錢。
translation: Pūrṇa Ki took these five coins and went to the market to buy firewood. He saw a bundle of firewood being sold for five coins, and Pūrṇa Ki bought the firewood and hired him for five coins.

source_sentence: 尋見牛頭栴檀香木在薪束中，意甚歡喜，持薪歸家，取此香木，分為十段。
translation: He was delighted to see the wood of the ox-head sandalwood in the bundle of firewood, so he took the firewood and returned home, divided the wood into ten pieces, and gave it to the king.

source_sentence: 值王夫人熱病之極，當須牛頭栴檀香木，摩以塗身以除其病，舉國推覓求之叵得，即令國內：「誰有香木一兩，當與黃金千兩。」
translation: When the king's wife became very ill with fever and needed cow-head sandalwood to rub on her body to remove her illness, she searched the country for it and found it unobtainable, so she ordered the king's household, "Whoever has one tael of fragrant wood will be given a thousand taels of gold."

source_sentence: 時富那奇，往應王募，持一小段，用奉王家；王如本令，償千兩金。
translation: Pūrṇa Ki then went to the king's house at his request, took a small piece of it, and presented it to the king's family; the king complied with his order and paid him a thousand taels of gold.

source_sentence: 如是展轉，十段香木，悉皆售盡，得金萬兩。
translation: As he went on like this, he sold all ten pieces of fragrant wood and got ten thousand taels of gold.

source_sentence: 因用起居，園田舍宅，象馬車乘，奴婢畜生，家業於是，豐富具足，過踰於前，合居數倍。
translation: As a result, he used his living quarters, lands, buildings, elephants, horses, chariots, servants, and animals, and his household was then supplied with an abundance of goods that exceeded his previous living quarters by a factor of several.

source_sentence: 爾時復有五百賈客，相與結要，欲入大海，喚富那奇，共為伴侶。
translation: At the time, there were another 500 merchants who had formed a group and wanted to go into the ocean, and they called Pūrṇa Ki to be their companion.

source_sentence: 富那白兄：「求共採寶。」
translation: Pūrṇa said to his brother, "We'd like to go searching for treasure together."

source_sentence: 兄即聽之，給其所須。
translation: The elder brother then listened and gave him what he needed.

source_sentence: 及伴往至大海，如意取寶，自重而還。
translation: He and his companion went to the ocean, took the treasure as they wished, and returned on their own weight.

source_sentence: 來至中道嶮難之處，眾人咸見閻浮提內有三日現，怪問導師：「今三日出，是何端應？」
translation: When they arrived at the difficult place in the middle path, the people all saw three days appear in Jambudvīpa and wondered to their guide, "What's the reason these three days have come out?"

source_sentence: 導師答言：「汝等當知！
translation: The guide replied, "You should know!

source_sentence: 一是正日，二是魚眼。」
translation: One is the true sun, and the other is the fish's eye."

source_sentence: 其間白者，「此是魚齒，今水所投，黑冥之處，是魚口也，最為可畏。
translation: The whites in between say, "These are fish teeth, and where the water now casts them, in the dark, is the mouth of a fish, which is most frightening.

source_sentence: 我等今者，無復活路，臨至魚口，定計垂死。」
translation: Now, there's no way for us to live again; when we reach the mouth of the fish, we're sure to die."

source_sentence: 有一賢者，敬信佛道，告語眾賈：「唯當虔心稱南無佛。
translation: A good man who was a devotee of the Buddha's path told the caravans, "Only reverently invoke Namo Buddha.

source_sentence: 三界德大，無過佛者，救厄赴急，矜濟一切，最能覆護苦厄眾生。
translation: There's no greater virtue in the three realms than that of the Buddha, who saves lives and responds to emergencies, provides relief for all, and is most able to protect sentient beings in distress and trouble.

source_sentence: 唯佛神聖！
translation: Only the Buddha is noble!

source_sentence: 願救危險，濟此諸人，毫氂之命。」
translation: May you save these people from danger and help them with their tiny lives."

source_sentence: 時摩竭魚，聞稱佛名，即還閉口，沈竄海底，眾賈於是，安隱還國。
translation: When the makara fish heard the Buddha's name, it shut its mouth and sank to the bottom of the ocean, and the merchants then returned to their country in peace.

source_sentence: 時富那奇，取大金案，以諸妙寶摩尼珠等，莊累積滿，奉兄羨那，長跪仰望，白大兄言：「我已為兄，積畜財寶，舍宅所有一切具足，子孫七世，食用不盡，唯願大兄！
translation: Pūrṇa Ki then took a large gold case and filled it with the precious jewels, such as the maṇi beads, and presented it to his brother Xena. He knelt down and looked up, saying to his elder brother, "I've accumulated wealth and treasure for you, and I have everything I need in my house, so my descendants won't be able to eat it all for seven generations.

source_sentence: 聽我出家。」
translation: Listen to me as I leave home."

source_sentence: 羨那答曰：「吾不相違，但卿少年，未達人倫，佛法要重，持之甚難，比更數年，乃可遂意。」
translation: Pūrṇa replied, "I won't disagree with you, but you're a young man who hasn't yet attained human decency, and it's very difficult to maintain the Buddha's teachings as important as they are.

source_sentence: 富那奇曰：「大兄當知！
translation: Pūrṇa wondered, "You should know that, big brother!

source_sentence: 人命無常，斯須難保。
translation: Human life is impermanent, and it's difficult to preserve it.

source_sentence: 前在大海，值摩竭魚，吸船趣口，命危垂死；蒙佛神恩，得濟餘命。
translation: A while ago, I was in the ocean when a makara fish sucked a boat into my mouth, and my life was in danger of dying.

source_sentence: 唯念垂許，聽在道次。」
translation: Please be so kind as to grant him permission to listen to him in the order of the (Buddha-)Path."

source_sentence: 兄即聽之。
translation: My brother then listened to him.

source_sentence: 時富那奇，與其五百採寶之眾，咸以信心至舍衛國，到於佛所，禮敬問訊，因具白佛，求索出家。
translation: Pūrṇa Ki and his group of five hundred treasure collectors all traveled to Śrāvastī with faith, went to the Buddha, paid their respects, exchanged greetings, and explained everything to him, asking him to leave home.

source_sentence: 佛即許可，聽使入道。
translation: The Buddha then approved and allowed them to enter the path.

source_sentence: 讚言：「善來！」
translation: He praised them, saying, "Well done!"

source_sentence: 便成沙門。
translation: They then became ascetics.

source_sentence: 佛為種種，苦切說法，五百比丘，心意開解，盡諸苦際，成阿羅漢。
translation: As a result of the Buddha's assorted and painful teachings, five hundred monks had their minds liberated, ended their suffering, and became arhats.

source_sentence: 唯富那奇，結使深重，佛為說法，未能暢達，精誠困篤，始入初果，勤精修習，無有休懈。
translation: Only Pūrṇaśi, who had deep bonds and tendencies that the Buddha couldn't penetrate in spite of his teaching, became sincere and devoted, and then entered the first realization, diligently cultivating it without laziness.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，安居日近，佛聽各各隨意安居。
translation: As the monks' retreat approached, the Buddha listened as each one settled down as he wished.

source_sentence: 時富那奇，往白佛言：「弟子欲往至放鉢國安居三月，唯願見聽。」
translation: Pūrṇa Ki then went to the Buddha and said, "I'd like to go to the country of Pāpāli for three months to settle down, but I'd like to see and hear you."

source_sentence: 於時世尊，告富那奇：「彼國人惡，信邪倒見，汝今初學，於佛法中，未能具足佛法聖行，設為彼人見毀辱者，當奈之何？」
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed Pūrṇa Ki, "The people of that country are evil and believe in wrong and mistaken views; now that you're a beginner, you haven't perfected the noble conduct of the Buddha's teaching.

source_sentence: 富那奇曰：「設令被人極理毀辱，但莫見害。」
translation: Pūrṇa Kiṃśi said, "Suppose someone is extremely mean and insulting, but they mustn't see harm."

source_sentence: 世尊又告：「彼人極惡，設被害時，當復云何？」
translation: The Bhagavān also told him, "When that person is extremely evil, suppose he's harmed, what will happen?"

source_sentence: 富那奇曰：「世尊當知！
translation: Pūrṇeccha said, "Bhagavān, you should know!

source_sentence: 正使彼人毀辱加害，莫斷我命，猶戢其恩。」
translation: That person will insult and harm you, but they won't cut off my life while they're still collecting their favors."

source_sentence: 佛又告曰：「汝往至彼，忽遭惡人，殘害汝命，無益於汝，當如之何？」
translation: The Buddha also told them, "When you go there and suddenly meet a bad person who hurts your life and doesn't help you, what should you do?"

source_sentence: 富那奇言：「世尊當知！
translation: Pūrṇa Kiṃśuka said, "Bhagavān, you should know!

source_sentence: 一切萬物，有形歸無。
translation: All the myriad things that have form return to nothing.

source_sentence: 彼若殺我，分受其死。」
translation: If they kill me, I'll share in their death."

source_sentence: 於時世尊告富那奇：「彼諸惡人，毀辱加害，及未斷命，汝當瞋不？」
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed Pūrṇeccha, "Will you be angry with those evil people who humiliate and inflict harm and whose lives have yet to be cut off?"

source_sentence: 富那奇曰：「不也。
translation: Pūrṇa Kiṃśuka said, "No.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 正使彼人無根見謗，毀辱極世不軌之事，設加刀杖，打害次殺，復未殘戮，臨當斷命，終不一念生起恚心。」
translation: It's exactly the kind of person who, having no religious faculties, sees a slander, disparages an extremely worldly misdeed, imposes a sword, beats, inflicts harm, kills next, and never kills again, and is about to lose his life when there's never a single thought of ill-will."

source_sentence: 佛即讚言：「善哉善哉！
translation: The Buddha then praised them, saying, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 弟子所行，唯是為快。」
translation: This is the only thing that a disciple does that's pleasant."

source_sentence: 時富那奇，攝持衣鉢，禮佛辭退，至放鉢國。
translation: Pūrṇa Ki then gathered his robe and bowl, paid homage to the Buddha, and withdrew to the land of the released banners.

source_sentence: 明日晨旦，入城乞食，至一大富婆羅門家。
translation: On the morrow, at sunrise, he went into the city to solicit alms and found himself at the home of a wealthy brāhmaṇa.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門，見是比丘，即懷惡心，而來罵逐，比丘即往異家乞食。
translation: When the brāhmaṇa saw this monk, he had bad intentions and rebuked him, so the monk went to another house to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 自其明日，續其舍乞食。
translation: On the following day, he continued to beg for food at his house.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門，復撾打極手，比丘歡喜，顏色不變。
translation: The brāhmaṇa then again beat him with his hands, but the monk rejoiced and his appearance didn't change.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門，覩此比丘，見毀被害，苦困垂死，而無怨色，不生瞋恨，便自悔責，懺謝已過。
translation: The Brāhmaṇa then saw this monk, who had been harmed and was dying of suffering, without resentful looks and without anger, and he repented and thanked himself for his mistakes.

source_sentence: 時富那奇，於彼國中，勤修不懈，盡諸結使，心忽開解，獲無漏證。
translation: Funachai then diligently cultivated unremitting efforts in that country to end the bonds and tendencies, and his mind was suddenly liberated and he attained untainted realization.

source_sentence: 安居已竟，便辭檀越，囑及其兄：「慎勿入海，大海中難甚多無數，兄之財寶，足用七世。」
translation: After he had finished his retreat, he left the donor and instructed his brother, "Don't go into the ocean; the difficulties in the ocean are too numerous for your wealth to last seven generations."

source_sentence: 囑及已竟，還往佛所，稽首問訊，問訊訖竟，隨意住止。
translation: After he had finished his instructions, he went back to the Buddha, paid his respects, and stayed there as he pleased after exchanging greetings.

source_sentence: 時兄羨那，不惟其勅，有諸眾賈，來歸羨那，種種曉喚，共入大海，羨那不逆，即可共去。
translation: Not only did he order him to do so, but he also had a group of merchants who came to him and were summoned at dawn to go into the ocean with him, and he didn't disobey them.

source_sentence: 至海渚上，隨意自重，唯有羨那，多取牛頭栴檀香木，滿船而還。
translation: When they reached the ocean, they did as they liked, except for Xena, who took much scented wood from the oxhead sandalwood and returned with the boat full of it.

source_sentence: 龍性慳悋，惜其香木，即於道中，捉其船舫，舉帆羅風，不能得過，一切眾客，定計恐死。
translation: Being stingy by nature, the dragon treasured the scented wood, so he caught his boat in the path, held up its sails and drew in the breeze, but couldn't get past it, and all the guests were sure to fear death.

source_sentence: 羨那一心，稱富那奇，「今遭苦厄，願見拔濟。」
translation: With one mind, Senna called Pūrṇa Ki, "Now that I'm in trouble, I wish to see relief."

source_sentence: 時富那奇，在舍衛國祇洹精舍，坐禪思惟，遙以天耳，聞兄羨那，處在危厄，至心自陳，悲酸一心，稱富那奇。
translation: Pūrṇa Ki was sitting in meditation and contemplating in the Jetavana monastery in Śrāvastī when, with the divine ear, he heard that his brother Xena was in danger and distress and declared to himself, with a single, pitying heart, that he was Pūrṇa Ki.

source_sentence: 富那奇即以羅漢神足，猶如健夫屈伸臂頃，變身化作金翅鳥王，至於大海，恐蹙其龍。
translation: Pūrṇa Ki then took the spiritual legs of a arhat, just like a strong man who flexes and extends his arms, and transformed himself into the garuḍa king, who went out into the ocean and feared to wriggle with his dragon.

source_sentence: 龍見鳥形，怖入海底，眾賈於是安隱還家。
translation: Seeing the bird's form, the dragon was terrified and plunged into the ocean floor, and the merchants then returned home in peace.

source_sentence: 時富那奇，教化其兄，令為世尊立一小堂，覆堂村木純以栴檀。
translation: Pūrṇa Ki then taught his brother to erect a small hall for the Bhagavān, covering it with wood made of sandalwood.

source_sentence: 其堂已成，教化其兄請佛。
translation: When the hall was finished, he instructed his brother to invite the Buddha.

source_sentence: 羨那答曰：「請佛之宜，以何等物能屈世尊？」
translation: He answered, "What would be an appropriate thing to invite the Buddha to, that would bend the Bhagavān over?"

source_sentence: 時富那奇，俱與其兄，辦足供養，各持香爐，共登高樓，遙向祇洹，燒香歸命佛及聖僧：「唯願明日，臨顧鄙國，開悟愚朦盲冥眾生。」
translation: Pūrṇa Ki and his brother then made a full offering, each holding a censer, climbed a high building, and headed far up to Jīvaka to burn incense and venerate the Buddha and the noble monks, "May tomorrow visit our country and enlighten foolish, blind, and ignorant sentient beings."

source_sentence: 作願已訖，香煙如意，乘虛往至世尊頂上，相結合聚作一煙蓋。
translation: After making the vow, the incense and smoke, as intended, rode up into the sky to the Bhagavān's summit, where they combined together to form a canopy of smoke.

source_sentence: 後遙以水，洗世尊足，水亦從虛，猶如釵股，如意徑到世尊足上。
translation: Then, he distantly washed the Bhagavān's feet with water, which also came out of nothingness like a lily-web and reached the Bhagavān's feet like a wish.

source_sentence: 爾時阿難，覩見是事，怪而問佛：「誰放煙水？」
translation: Seeing this, Ānanda was surprised and asked the Buddha, "Who put the smoke and water there?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「是富那奇羅漢比丘，於放鉢國，勸兄羨那，請佛及僧，故放煙水，以為信請。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "That monk Pūrṇa Kiṃrahan was in the land of the released bowls when he encouraged his brother Śena to invite the Buddha and the saṃgha, so he released the smoke and water as a sign of faith."

source_sentence: 因勅阿難：「往至僧中，行籌告語神足比丘，明日悉來，往應羨那請，因現變化，以遊彼國。」
translation: I commanded Ānanda, "Go to the saṃgha, make preparations, and tell the monk Shenzu that he'll come tomorrow and respond to Xena's invitation to travel to that country because of the transformation that takes place there."

source_sentence: 阿難奉命，合僧行籌，有神足者，明當受請。
translation: Ānanda complied, combining the saṃgha's efforts with their own, and those who had spiritual legs were told to accept the invitation.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，各各受籌。
translation: Each of the monks then accepted the offering.

source_sentence: 明日晨旦，僧作食人，名奇虔直奇(此言續生)，其人已得阿那含道，恒日供給一切眾僧，結跏趺坐，身放光明，四出照曜，引作食具，瓢杓健支，百斛大釜，而隨其後，乘虛飛行，趣向其國。
translation: Tomorrow morning at sunrise, a monk named Qiguiqie (this word means continuity of birth), who had attained the path of non-returners and spent his days making offerings to all the saṃgha, sat cross-legged, emitted a bright light from his body that shone in all directions, drew out a container of food, a ladle, a ladle, and a hundred large caldrons, and followed him as he flew through the sky on his way to that country.

source_sentence: 羨那問曰：「是汝師不？」
translation: Śena asked, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答言：「非也。
translation: They replied, "No.

source_sentence: 是諸比丘，作食之人，故來相佐，辦具飲食。」
translation: These monks, who are the ones who make the offerings, have come to assist them in preparing food and drink."

source_sentence: 於是羨那，即以華香妓樂供養，供養畢竟，即便過去。
translation: Śena then made offerings of flowers, incense, and music, and when he had finished making offerings, he left.

source_sentence: 次後復有十六沙彌均提之等，各以神足，變作樹林，採華採果，種種變現，演身光明，晃曜天地，凌虛繼邁，駱驛而到。
translation: Next, there were 16 novices who each had the spiritual powers to transform themselves into a forest, gather flowers and fruits, and make various appearances, projecting their bodies in a radiant way that shone brightly above the heavens and earth, and arrived by caravan.

source_sentence: 羨那復問：「是汝師不？」
translation: Śena then asked, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「非也。
translation: They replied, "No.

source_sentence: 斯諸人等，先前來者，乃是我等同師弟子，年始七歲，得羅漢道，諸漏永盡，神足純備，今故先來採華具果。」
translation: These people who came earlier are my fellow disciples who were seven years old when they attained the path of the arhat, permanently ended the contaminants, and were fully endowed with spiritual abilities; they therefore came earlier to gather flowers and complete offerings."

source_sentence: 即以華香，具足供養，供養訖已，各各過去。
translation: They then made a full offering of flowers and incense, and after making their offerings, they each departed.

source_sentence: 次復耆年大阿羅漢，化作千龍，結身為座，頭皆四出，雷吼震天，其諸龍口，悉雨七寶，復於其上，施大寶座，飛昇虛空，身放光明，照曜天下，而來至國。
translation: Next, a great arhat of advanced years transformed himself into a thousand dragons, formed his body into a throne, had his head produced in four directions, thundered, and shook the heavens with a thunderous roar, and all of the dragons' mouths rained down seven treasures.

source_sentence: 羨那復問：「是汝師不？」
translation: Śena then asked, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「非也。
translation: He answered, "No. This is Kauṇḍinya's disciple named Kauṇḍinya.

source_sentence: 是師弟子，名憍陳如，佛初得道，在鹿野苑，初轉法輪，廣度眾生，斯等五人，最先受化，於弟子中，第一上首，神通具足，無所罣礙。」
translation: These are the five disciples of the teacher named Kauṇḍinya who first attained the way, first turned the wheel of the Dharma in Deer Preserve, and extensively liberated sentient beings; they were the first and foremost of their disciples to be transformed, were the most eminent, and had complete superknowledge and were unimpeded."

source_sentence: 羨那聞說，倍加恭敬，香華妓樂，悉以供養，供養已訖，即便過去。
translation: Hearing what they said, Sugata paid extra respect, offered flowers, music, and music to all of them, and then passed away after making his offerings.

source_sentence: 次後復有摩訶迦葉，化作七寶講堂，七寶莊校，奮身光明，晃昱四布，往至其國。
translation: Next, there was Mahākāśyapa, who transformed himself into a seven-jeweled lecture hall, a seven-jeweled school, an exciting body of light, and a shining light that spread out in four directions, and went to his country.

source_sentence: 羨那見之，問富那奇：「是汝師不？」
translation: Seeing him, Śena asked Pūrṇaçi, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「非也。
translation: He answered, "No.

source_sentence: 是師弟子，摩訶迦葉，清儉知足，常行頭陀，愍諸廝賤，賑濟貧乏。」
translation: This teacher's disciple, Mahākāśyapa, is frugal and contented, always conducts himself as an ascetic, pities the lowly, and provides relief for the poor."

source_sentence: 羨那即以香華妓樂，供養畢訖，即時過去。
translation: Śena then made offerings of flowers, flowers, and music, and departed immediately.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗，次後乘千師子，槃身為座，頭皆四出，口雨七寶，雷吼咆哮，震動天地，復於其上，敷大寶床，莊校嚴飾，而處其上，身出光明，普照四域，飛騰虛空，翱翔而至。
translation: Śāriputra then, followed by a thousand lions in a carriage, made a seat out of his body, with his head protruding in four directions, his mouth raining seven treasures, and a thunderous roar that shook heaven and earth, spread out a large jeweled bed on top of it, adorned and decorated it, and placed it there with his body shining brightly, shining universally in the four regions, soaring through the sky, and arriving in flight.

source_sentence: 羨那問曰：「是汝師不？」
translation: Śena asked, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「非也。
translation: He answered, "No.

source_sentence: 今乘來者，是師大弟子，廣博大智，名舍利弗。」
translation: The one who's coming in this vehicle is a great disciple of the master with vast and great wisdom named Śāriputra."

source_sentence: 羨那聞已，倍增歡喜，即以華香妓樂供養，供養訖已，即以過去。
translation: After hearing this, Śaṇṇa was doubly delighted and offered flowers, incense, and music as an offering, and when he had finished making offerings, he departed.

source_sentence: 時大目連，尋後而發，化作千象，羅頭四出，其諸象口，皆有六牙，其一牙頭，有七浴池水，一一池中，有七蓮華，其一華上，有七玉女，種種變現，其數無量，放大光明，感動四隣，復於其上，安置寶座，自坐其上，乘虛徑至。
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana then looked behind him and aroused, transforming himself into a thousand elephants with four heads, each with six tusks in its mouth, seven bathing pools of water at the head of one tusk, seven lotus flowers in each pool, seven jade maidens on top of one flower, and countless other things that magnified their light and moved the four neighbors.

source_sentence: 羨那問曰：「是汝師不？」
translation: Śena asked, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答言：「非也。
translation: He replied, "No.

source_sentence: 是師弟子，名大目連，神足第一，德行純備。」
translation: This is the master's disciple named Mahāmaudgalyāyana, who has the most excellent spiritual abilities and whose virtues are perfectly complete."

source_sentence: 羨那聞說，歡喜戴仰，香華妓樂，而以供養，供養已，即便過去。
translation: Hearing what he said, Sena rejoiced, revered, and offered flowers, music, and music to make offerings, and then he passed away after making those offerings.

source_sentence: 次後復有阿那律提，而自化作七寶浴池，浴池中復生金色蓮華，蓮莖皆是七寶合成，處其華上，結跏趺坐，項佩日光，照曜天下，光所照處，皆是金色，乘虛至國。
translation: Next, there was Aniruddha, who transformed himself into a bath of seven treasures, and in that bath there again arose a golden lotus with stems made of seven treasures, sitting cross-legged on top of the lotus, wearing sunlight on his head that shone brightly on the whole world, and everywhere it shone, it was golden, and he rode into the sky to his country.

source_sentence: 羨那復問：「是汝師不？」
translation: Again, Śena asked, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答言：「非也。
translation: He replied, "No.

source_sentence: 是師弟子，阿那律提，於是大眾，天眼第一。」
translation: This is the master's disciple, Aniruddha, who has the best divine vision of the whole assembly."

source_sentence: 羨那聞之，歡喜恭敬，華香供養，即自過去。
translation: Hearing this, Śena rejoiced and venerated him, offered flowers and incense, and departed.

source_sentence: 次後復有佛弟難陀，化作千馬，駕七寶車，車上復有七寶大蓋，放演光明，四出照曜，乘虛馳至，詣放鉢國。
translation: Next, there was another disciple of the Buddha, Nandha, who was transformed into a thousand horses and drove a seven-jeweled chariot with another seven-jeweled great lid on top of it that radiated light and shone in all directions, and rode up in the sky to the country of Bombay.

source_sentence: 羨那見之，問富那奇：「是汝師不？」
translation: Seeing him, Śena asked Pūrṇaçi, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答言：「非也。
translation: He replied, "No.

source_sentence: 是世尊弟，名曰難陀，眾相具足，德行純備。」
translation: This is the Bhagavān's disciple named Nandha, who has many characteristics and whose virtues are perfectly complete."

source_sentence: 羨那即以香華妓樂，供養畢訖，即自過去。
translation: Śena then made offerings of flowers, flowers, music, and music, and departed.

source_sentence: 時須菩提次後復來，作七寶山，坐瑠璃窟，身放種種雜色光明，照曜天地，來至其國。
translation: Subsequently, Subhūti came back, made a mountain of seven treasures, sat in a cave of lapis lazuli, and radiated a variety of lights that shone brightly on heaven and earth as he arrived in his country.

source_sentence: 羨那問曰：「是汝師不？」
translation: Śena asked, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答言：「非也。
translation: He replied, "No.

source_sentence: 是師弟子，名須菩提，廣智多聞，解空第一。」
translation: This is the master's disciple named Subhūti, who has extensive knowledge and is well-versed and is the most knowledgeable about emptiness."

source_sentence: 即以華香，供養畢訖，即自過去。
translation: After making an offering of flowers and incense, he departed.

source_sentence: 次有分耨文陀尼子，化作一千迦樓羅王，結身為座，四向羅頭，口含眾寶，發哀和音，復於其上，施大寶座，而坐其上，乘虛來至。
translation: Next, there was Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, who was transformed into a thousand kalala kings, formed a throne with his body bound in four directions, held numerous treasures in his mouth, made a sad and harmonious noise, gave a large jeweled throne on top of it, sat on it, and rode into the sky.

source_sentence: 羨那問曰：「是汝師不？」
translation: Śena asked, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答言：「非也。
translation: He replied, "No.

source_sentence: 是我同師，名曰分耨文陀尼子，辯才應適，最為第一。」
translation: This is my fellow teacher, named Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, who is the most eloquent and appropriate, and he's the best."

source_sentence: 即以華香，供養訖已，便自過去。
translation: He then offered flowers and incense as an offering and departed.

source_sentence: 次復弟子，名優波離，化作千鴈聚身相結，頭口出聲，哀鳴相和，口含眾寶，飛翔虛空，於其身上，敷眾寶座，放大光明，照曜四遠，身坐其上，馳奔來至。
translation: The next disciple, named Upāli, was transformed into a thousand animals with their bodies bound together, their heads and mouths making noises and wailing in unison, and they flew through the sky with all the treasures in their mouths, spread out a multitude of jeweled seats on their bodies, radiated brightly, shone from four distances, and came galloping up while sitting on them.

source_sentence: 羨那問曰：「是汝師不？」
translation: Śena asked, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「非也。
translation: He answered, "No.

source_sentence: 是師弟子，名優波離，於眾比丘，持律第一。」
translation: This is the master's disciple named Upāli, who is the best among the monks in terms of observing the precepts."

source_sentence: 羨那聞已，即持華香，供養畢訖，即復過去。
translation: After hearing this, Śena brought flowers and incense, made offerings, and returned to the past.

source_sentence: 次後復有沙門二十億，化作行樹於虛空中，以紺瑠璃，作經行道，復以七寶，夾樹兩邊，種種妙寶，以界道側，於中經行，漸至其國。
translation: Next, there were another 2 billion ascetics who were transformed into a walking tree in the sky and made a sūtra path out of violet glass, and then they placed seven treasures on either side of the tree and various wonderful treasures to border the path as they traveled through it and gradually reached their country.

source_sentence: 羨那問曰：「是汝師不？」
translation: Śena asked, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「非也。
translation: They replied, "No.

source_sentence: 是佛弟子，名曰沙門二十億，於比丘中，精進第一。」
translation: These are the two billion disciples of the Buddha called ascetics, and they are the most zealous among monks."

source_sentence: 華香妓樂，供養畢訖，即便過去。
translation: After making offerings with flowers, incense, and music, he then departed.

source_sentence: 次後復有大劫賓寧，化作七寶樹，樹上復有種種華果，樹下皆有七寶高座，處其座上，放大光明，乘虛來至。
translation: Next, there was another great eon, Binnin, who was transformed into a seven-jewel tree with various flowers and fruits on top and a high, seven-jeweled throne underneath it, and from that throne, a great radiant light came riding through the sky.

source_sentence: 羨那問曰：「是汝師不？」
translation: Sugata asked, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「非也。
translation: He answered, "No.

source_sentence: 是佛弟子，名劫賓寧，挺特勇猛，端正第一。」
translation: This is a disciple of the Buddha named Kapphiṇa, who is quite courageous and correct."

source_sentence: 羨那聞已，歡喜供養華香妓樂，供養已訖，即自過去。
translation: After hearing this, Senna rejoiced and made offerings of flowers, incense, and music, and after making his offerings, he departed.

source_sentence: 次有弟子名賓頭盧埵闍，坐寶蓮華，項佩日光，放千光明，暉赫天地，飛昇虛空，來至其國。
translation: Next, there was a disciple named Piṇḍolabbaradvāja who was sitting on a jeweled lotus, wore a sunbeam on his neck, radiated a thousand lights that shone brightly above heaven and earth, and flew up into the sky to his country.

source_sentence: 羨那問曰：「是汝師不？」
translation: Sena asked, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「非也。
translation: He answered, "No.

source_sentence: 是師弟子，名賓頭盧埵闍，善能入定，坐禪第一。」
translation: This is the master's disciple named Piṇḍolabbaradvāja, who's good at entering meditation and is the best at sitting in meditation."

source_sentence: 即以香華，供養畢訖，即自過去。
translation: He then offered incense and flowers, finished making offerings, and departed.

source_sentence: 次羅睺羅，尋後趣引，自化其身，作轉輪王，千子七寶，皆悉具足，導從前後，來至其國。
translation: Next, Rāhula, seeking guidance from a later destination, transformed his body into a wheel-turning king complete with a thousand sons and seven treasures, and led them to his country from front to back.

source_sentence: 羨那問曰：「是汝師不？」
translation: Śena asked, "Is this your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「非也。
translation: He answered, "No. This is the son of the Buddha named Rāhula.

source_sentence: 是佛之子，名曰羅睺羅，設在家者，領四天下，七寶自至，兵仗不用，自然降附，今捨此位，出家學道，得阿羅漢，六通清徹，無所罣礙，今故變身，作是形位。」
translation: This is the son of the Buddha named Rāhula, who was once at home, led the four worlds, arrived with seven treasures, didn't use armaments, and naturally subjugated himself.

source_sentence: 羨那聞已，香華供養，即自過去。
translation: After hearing this, Śena offered flowers and incense and departed.

source_sentence: 五百神足弟子，各各現變，不可稱計。
translation: Each of the five hundred disciples of the Buddha's priests undertook incalculable transformations.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，知諸弟子盡適彼國，放大光明，照曜天地，普皆金色。
translation: Knowing that all of his disciples were fit for that country, the Bhagavān then magnified their light, shining brightly and brilliantly, and the whole world was golden.

source_sentence: 時富那奇，語其兄曰：「今者世尊，始欲發意而來至此，故先放光，作是瑞應。」
translation: Pūrṇa Ki then said to his brother, "Now, the Bhagavān first wanted to arouse his intention to come here, so he first emitted a ray of light that gave rise to this auspicious response."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，始於座上，下足躡地，應時天地，六反震動。
translation: The Bhagavān then began to step down from his seat and place his feet on the ground, and when he did, the heavens and earth shook six times.

source_sentence: 時富那奇，語其兄曰：「今者世尊，始於座上，下足躡地，以是之故，天地大動。」
translation: Pūrṇa Ki then said to his brother, "The Bhagavān first got up on his seat and put his feet on the ground; as a result, the heavens and earth trembled greatly."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，始出精舍，住在於外，八金剛神住於八面；時四天王在前導道；時天帝釋，從諸欲界天子百千萬眾，侍衛左面；大梵天王，與色界諸天無央數眾，住在右面；弟子阿難，住在佛後；大眾圍遶，放演光明，照曜天地，飛昇虛空，趣放鉢國。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān first emerged from his abode and stayed outside while eight adamantine spirits stayed on eight sides; the four heavenly kings were leading the way; the god Indra and his titans of sons of gods in the desire realm were guarding him on the left; the king of Brahmā and an incalculable multitude of gods in the form realm were staying on the right; and his disciple Ānanda was staying behind the Buddha; the great multitude surrounded him, emitted a radiance that shone brightly, radiated heaven and earth, and flew up into the sky to the land of Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 於其中道，逢五百作人，以千具犁牛，墾治隴畝，諸牛見佛乘空而過，身放金色普照世界，諸牛至心，仰視世尊，心存篤敬，住隴不行。
translation: On their path, they met 500 makers who plowed a vast field with a thousand oxen, and when the oxen saw the Buddha riding through the sky, his body radiating gold and shining broadly in the world, the oxen looked up to the Bhagavān with utmost respect, and they didn't stop there.

source_sentence: 作人見牛仰向觀瞻，驚怪所以，亦視見佛，即各跪白：「咸興歸誠，唯願如來！
translation: When the workers saw the oxen looking up and gazing at them, they were surprised and looked at the Buddha, so they each knelt down and said, "All rise up in reverence, and I hope the Tathāgata!

source_sentence: 當見哀愍暫下開度，使離生死。」
translation: He will see that pity temporarily enlightens and liberates them from birth and death."

source_sentence: 佛以悲心，知其可度，即下為說種種妙法，五百作人，心意開悟，斷二十億洞然之惡，成須陀洹。
translation: With compassion, the Buddha knew he could be saved, so he went down and taught various wonderful things for 500 people, enlightened their minds, ended 2 billion immoral deeds, and became a stream entrant.

source_sentence: 時牛命終，盡生天上，普皆歡喜。
translation: When the lives of the cattle ended, they were all born up in heaven, and everyone rejoiced.

source_sentence: 於時如來，即復發引，到前未遠，有五百童女，共遊曠野，見地金色，仰視其變，見乘虛而行，咸懷歡喜，叉手白言：「唯願天尊！
translation: The Tathāgata then again led them, and not far before they arrived, there were five hundred young girls wandering together in a wilderness who saw the golden ground, looked up at their transformation, and rejoiced when they saw them riding in the sky.

source_sentence: 垂心矜愍暫見濟度。」
translation: Please have compassion on him and allow him to see relief for a while."

source_sentence: 佛知其宿行應可度化，即稱所願，往至其所，隨應堪能，為說諸法；信受開解，成須陀洹。
translation: Knowing that his past life would make it possible to save him, the Buddha acknowledged his wish, went to him, explained the teachings as he was able, and became a stream entrant with faith and understanding.

source_sentence: 變感已竟，遂步而至。
translation: After he had finished his transformation, he then stepped forward and arrived.

source_sentence: 復有五百仙人，處在林澤，見光普照地悉金色，仰覩如來與諸大眾遊行乘虛，心懷踊躍，敬心倍隆，仰請佛言：「唯願大聖！
translation: There were also five hundred sages who were in a forest and saw the light shining everywhere on the ground, and they looked at the Tathāgata and the great crowd marching through the sky, and their hearts leapt with joy and respect as they looked up to the Buddha and said, "May it be, great sage!

source_sentence: 暫勞神形，因見過度，聽在道次。」
translation: He temporarily labored in spirit and form, saw that he had crossed over, and listened to him in the sequence of the path."

source_sentence: 佛覩其本緣，知之應度，尋下在前。
translation: Seeing his original connection, the Buddha knew he should be saved and looked him down before him.

source_sentence: 求作沙門，佛即聽之：「善來比丘！」
translation: He asked to become an ascetic, and the Buddha listened to him, "Well come, monk!"

source_sentence: 便成沙門，因為說法，心淨開解，諸漏永盡，成阿羅漢；隨從佛後，乘空而至。
translation: He then became an ascetic, and as a result of his teaching, his mind was purified and liberated, the contaminants were permanently ended, and he became an arhat; he followed the Buddha and rode into the sky.

source_sentence: 時富那奇，遙見佛來，光曜天地，大眾虛轉，語兄羨那：「世尊及眾，今始來至。」
translation: Pūrṇeccha then saw the Buddha coming from afar, his radiance shining brightly above heaven and earth, and the crowd in a state of motion, and he said to his brother Xena, "The Bhagavān and his entourage have just arrived."

source_sentence: 佛到其國，羨那歡喜，即以香華及眾妓樂，供養畢訖，共至會所。
translation: When the Buddha arrived in his country, Śena rejoiced and offered flowers, incense, and music to the monks, and they all went to the meeting place.

source_sentence: 佛至其舍，如法就坐，羨那合家，供辦甘饍，自行澡水，敬意奉食，佛為噠嚫，食訖澡漱，為其舉國合家大小，演說妙法，合家一切，得須陀洹。
translation: When the Buddha arrived at their residence and took his seat according to the teaching, the Enā family offered a delicious meal, washed themselves in water, paid respects, and served food. The Buddha offered a large meal, washed them after they finished eating, and explained the wonderful Dharma to the entire family and its members, who all became streamers.

source_sentence: 有具二道三四果者，復有發意趣大乘者，復有堅住不退地者。
translation: There were those who had completed the second path, the third and fourth fruits, those who had awakened the intention to enter the great vehicle, and those who had firmly stayed in the ground of nonretrogression.

source_sentence: 佛說法訖，舉國男女，得度者眾，不可稱計。
translation: After the Buddha finished teaching the Dharma, there were an incalculable number of men and women from that country who had been saved.

source_sentence: 阿難長跪，叉手合掌，前白佛言：「不審，世尊！
translation: Ānanda knelt down long, folded his palms, and said to the Buddha, "I don't think so, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此富那奇，過去世中，作何惡行，為人下賤，屬他為奴？
translation: "What kinds of bad deeds did this Puṇyacha do in his past lives that made him a lowly person and a slave to others?

source_sentence: 復有何福，遇佛得度？」
translation: What further merit is there in meeting a Buddha and being saved?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「欲知之者，明聽善思！
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Those who want to know this, listen clearly and well consider it!

source_sentence: 當為汝說。」
translation: I'll explain it for you."

source_sentence: 對曰：「唯然，願具開示。」
translation: He replied, "Yes, I'd like to explain it fully."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「乃往過去迦葉佛時，有一長者，財富無數，為佛眾僧興僧伽藍，衣服飲食病瘦醫藥四事供辦，供給一切無有乏短。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Once upon a time, when Kāśyapa Buddha was alive, there was an elderly man with incalculable wealth who built a monk's kalāna for the Buddha's congregation, making offerings of clothing, food, drink, sickness, and medicine, and making provisions for everything without any loss.

source_sentence: 爾時長者遇疾命終，其後一兒出家學道，其父死後佛圖供具，皆悉轉少，眾僧罷散，其寺荒壞，無人住止。
translation: When the elder met with illness and died, a son left home and trained on the path. After his father's death, all of the Buddha's offerings became scarce, the saṃgha was scattered, and his temple was deserted with no one to stay.

source_sentence: 其兒比丘，勤力招合檀越知識，積聚錢財，修補缺落，復合眾僧，還繼供養。
translation: The monk's son diligently recruited a group of patrons, gathered money and property, repaired the deficiencies, and returned to the monks with them to make offerings.

source_sentence: 於時多眾，住在其寺，勤精專修，具諸道者，時彼道人，作僧自在。
translation: When that large group of people stayed at his temple and diligently concentrated on the cultivation of those who possessed the Way, that man of the Way became a monk at ease.

source_sentence: 時有羅漢道人，次知日直，掃除草土，積在中庭，不時除棄。
translation: Then, there was a arhat layman who, knowing the next day to be straight, swept up the grass and dirt and left it in the courtyard, discarding it from time to time.

source_sentence: 於時比丘，惡心呵叱：『今此比丘，如奴無異，雖知掃地，不能除棄。』
translation: The monk then shouted at him with a bad heart, 'Now, that monk is like a slave, no different than a slave, who knows how to sweep the ground but can't get rid of it.'

source_sentence: 阿難當知！
translation: Ānanda, you should know!

source_sentence: 彼時比丘，大自在者，今富那奇比丘是也。
translation: That monk, the one with great mastery, was the present-day Monk Pūrṇaśaila.

source_sentence: 由其惡心呵得道人比之為奴，由此一言，五百世中，恒為奴身。
translation: Because of his evil intentions, he ridiculed those of the Way as slaves, and because of that one statement, he remained a slave for 500 lifetimes.

source_sentence: 復由興立勸合眾人供養眾僧，償罪已畢，復遭我世，蒙得過度。
translation: After he had finished repaying his sins by encouraging others to support the saṃgha, he was again reborn into our world and was granted a pass.

source_sentence: 今此國中，受化之人，皆是往昔勸助之眾，緣是果報，皆得度脫。」
translation: Now, in this country, the people who are trained are all those who were encouraged in the past, and because of this result, they've all been liberated."

source_sentence: 阿難之等，及與眾會，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Ānanda and the others who gathered there heard what the Buddha taught, rejoiced, and approved.

source_sentence: （三五）尼提度緣品第三十
translation: (35) Nidhi-dhūta-rāja-parivarta (Chapter 30)

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時舍衛城中，人民眾多，居止隘迮，廁溷尠少，大小便利，多往出城。
translation: At the time, there were many people in the city of Śrāvastī who lived in a narrow and confined area, had few lavatories and piles, and had large and small conveniences that often led them out of the city.

source_sentence: 或有豪尊，不能去者，便利在器中，雇人除之。
translation: Some might be too proud to leave, so they put their conveniences in a container and hired someone to remove them.

source_sentence: 時有一人，名曰尼提，極貧至賤，無所趣向，仰客作除糞，得價自濟。
translation: At the time, there was a man named Nidhi, who was extremely poor and lowly, with no place to go, and he looked to a customer to remove his dung and obtain a price to help himself.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，即知其應度，獨將阿難，入於城內，欲拔濟之。
translation: Knowing he should be saved, the Bhagavān sent Ānanda into the city alone, intending to rescue him.

source_sentence: 到一里頭，正值尼提，持一瓦器，盛滿不淨，欲往棄之。
translation: When he arrived at the end of a mile, he saw Nidhi holding a tile container full of impurities that he wanted to throw away.

source_sentence: 遙見世尊，極懷鄙愧，退從異道，隱屏欲去。
translation: Seeing the Bhagavān from afar, he was so ashamed that he retreated down a different path, retreating and wanting to leave.

source_sentence: 垂當出里，復見世尊，倍用鄙恥，迴趣餘道，復欲避去，心意怱忙，以瓶打壁，瓶即破壞，屎尿澆身，深生慚愧，不忍見佛。
translation: When he was about to leave the neighborhood and saw the Bhagavān again, he was doubly ashamed and went back to another path. Again, he wanted to avoid it, but his thoughts were hurried, so he struck the wall with the pot, which immediately broke, and dung and urine poured over his body.

source_sentence: 是時世尊，就到其所，語尼提言：「欲出家不？」
translation: The Bhagavān then went to him and said to Nidhi, "Do you want to leave home?"

source_sentence: 尼提答言：「如來尊重，金輪王種，翼從弟子，悉是貴人；我下賤弊惡之極，云何同彼而得出家？」
translation: Nidhi replied, "The Tathāgata honors the Golden Wheel King lineage, and his followers are all noble people; how could I be so lowly and mean that I could leave home with them?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「我法清妙，猶如淨水，悉能洗除一切垢穢；亦如大火能燒諸物，大小好惡，皆能焚之。
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "My teaching is pure and exquisite, like pure water that thoroughly cleanses away all impurity, and like a great fire that burns things, large and small, good and bad, it burns them all.

source_sentence: 我法亦爾，弘廣無邊，貧富貴賤，男之與女，有能修者，皆盡諸欲。」
translation: Similarly, my teaching is so vast and limitless that it will end the desires of rich and poor, noble and poor, men and women who are able to cultivate it."

source_sentence: 是時尼提，聞佛所說，信心即生，欲得出家。
translation: Nidhi then heard what the Buddha taught, and his faith grew as he desired to leave home.

source_sentence: 佛使阿難將出城外，大河水邊，洗浴其身，已得淨潔，將詣祇洹，為說經法，苦切之理，生死可畏，涅槃永安；霍然意解，獲初果證，合掌向佛，求作沙門。
translation: The Buddha sent Ānanda out of the city to wash his body by the water of a large river, and he was cleansed and about to go to Jetavana to explain the sūtras and teachings, the principle of suffering and cutting, the fearfulness of birth and death, and the eternal security of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 佛即告曰：「善來比丘！」
translation: The Buddha then told him, "Well done, monks!"

source_sentence: 鬚髮自落，法衣在身，佛重解說四諦要法，諸漏得盡，成阿羅漢，三明六通，皆悉具足。
translation: With his hair falling out and the Dharma robe on, the Buddha repeatedly explained the essentials of the four truths, ended the contaminants, became an arhat, and fully equipped him with the three insights and six powers.

source_sentence: 爾時國人，聞尼提出家，咸懷怨心，而作是言：「云何世尊，聽此賤人出家學道？
translation: When the people of that country heard that Nimi had left home, they all harbored resentment and said, "Why, Bhagavān, did you hear this lowly man leave home and train on the path?

source_sentence: 我等如何，為其禮拜？
translation: How are we to pay homage to them?

source_sentence: 設作供養，請佛及僧，斯人若來，污我床席。」
translation: I'll make offerings to the Buddha and the saṃgha, but if this person comes, he'll defile my bed and seat."

source_sentence: 展轉相語，乃聞於王。
translation: They kept talking to each other, and it was heard from the king.

source_sentence: 王聞亦怨恨，情用反側，即乘羽葆之車，與諸侍從，往詣祇洹，欲問如來所疑之事。
translation: Resentful at what he heard, the king was overcome with emotion. He rode in a feathered chariot with his attendants and went to Jetavana to ask the Tathāgata about the matter he had doubted.

source_sentence: 既到門前，且小停息。
translation: When they arrived at the gate, they made a short pause.

source_sentence: 祇洹門外，有一大石，尼提比丘，坐於石岩，縫補故衣，有七百天人，各持華香，而供養之，右遶敬禮。
translation: Outside the gate of Jetavana, there was a large rock where the monk Nidhi was sitting on a rock, sewing his old robes, and there were 700 celestials each bringing flowers and incense to make offerings to him, circling to his right and venerating him.

source_sentence: 時王覩見，深用歡喜，到比丘所，而語之言：「我欲見佛，願為通白。」
translation: When the king saw this, he was deeply delighted and went to the monk and said, "I want to see the Buddha, so please explain this to him."

source_sentence: 比丘即時，身沒石中，踊出於內，白世尊曰：「波斯匿王，今者在外，欲得來入覲省諮問。」
translation: Immediately, the monk plunged himself into a stone, roused himself inside, and said to the Bhagavān, "King Prasenajit, I'm outside now and would like to come in to visit and consult with you."

source_sentence: 佛告尼提：「從汝本道，往語令前。」
translation: The Buddha told Nidhi, "From your original path, go and tell him to come forward."

source_sentence: 尼提尋時，還從石出，如似出水，無有罣礙，即語王言：「白佛已竟，王可進前。」
translation: When he looked, Nidhi emerged from the rock again, like out of water, unobstructed, and said to the king, "After you've told the Buddha, the king may go forward."

source_sentence: 王作此念：「向所疑事，且當置之，先當請問，此比丘者，有何福行，神力乃爾？」
translation: The king then had this thought, "Let's put aside what we had doubted and first ask, 'What merit and virtue does this monk possess that makes him so powerful?'"

source_sentence: 王入見佛，稽首佛足，右遶三匝，却坐一面，白世尊言：「向者比丘，神力難及，入石如水，出石無孔，姓字何等？
translation: The king went in to see the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, circled him three times to his right, withdrew to sit to one side, and said to the Bhagavān, "That monk, whose powers are difficult to match, who enters a stone like water and exits it without a hole, what's his surname and forename?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「是王國中，極賤之人，我已化度，得阿羅漢，大王故來，欲問斯義。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "I've saved this extremely lowly person in the kingdom and made him an arhat, so the king has come to ask about his meaning."

source_sentence: 王聞佛語，慢心即除，欣悅無量，因告王曰：「凡人處世，尊卑貴賤，貧富苦樂，皆由宿行，而致斯果仁慈謙順，敬長愛小，則為貴人；凶惡強梁，憍恣自大，則為賤人。」
translation: Upon hearing the Buddha's words, the king's conceit was immediately removed and his joy was immeasurable. He told the king, "Whenever people go through life, they're noble and lowly, rich and poor, and they experience suffering and happiness because of their past actions. Being kind and humble, respecting the elderly and loving the young, they're noble; being mean and strong, arrogant and proud, they're lowly."

translation: I will explain it to you so that you'll be enlightened.

translation: It was long ago that the Tathāgata Kāśyapa appeared in the world and, after he had ceased to exist, there were 100,000 monks and nuns.

translation: Among them was an ascetic who made himself at home as a monk, took medicine for his illness, became arrogant and arrogant, didn't come out of his position, used a gold and silver bath to bathe his body, filled it with urine, and had one of his disciples carry it to his disposal.

source_sentence: 然其弟子，是須陀洹。
translation: That disciple, however, was a stream-winner.

source_sentence: 由在彼世，不能謙順，自恃多財，秉捉僧事，暫有微患，懶不自起，驅役聖人，令除糞穢。
translation: In that world, he wasn't able to be humble, relied on his own wealth, took charge of the saṃgha's affairs, and didn't bother to get up when there was a slight problem, so he drove the sage to remove the excrement.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，流浪生死，恒為下賤，五百世中，為人除糞，乃至於今。
translation: Because of this cause, he wandered through birth and death, always remained inferior, and removed people's excrement for five hundred generations, even up to the present.

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「欲知爾時僧自在者，今尼提比丘是。」
translation: The Buddha told the king, "The monk Nidhi now is the one who wants to know about the saṃgha's mastery at that point in time."

source_sentence: 波斯匿王白世尊言：「如來出世，實為奇特，利益無量苦惱眾生。」
translation: King Prasenajit said to the Bhagavān, "The Tathāgata's appearance in the world is truly marvelous and benefits measureless suffering sentient beings."

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「善哉善哉！

source_sentence: 佛又告曰：「三界輪轉，無有定品，積善仁和，生於豪尊；習惡放恣，便生卑賤。」
translation: The Buddha also told him, "There's no set class of transmigration in the three realms; those who accumulate goodness and kindness will be born noble and honorable, while those who cultivate bad indulgence will be born lowly."

source_sentence: 王大歡喜，無有慢心，即起長跪，執尼提足，而為作禮，懺悔自謝，願除罪咎。
translation: The king was greatly elated and had no pride in it, so he got up, knelt down long, took Nidhi's feet, paid homage, repented, and thanked him, wishing to be freed from blame.

source_sentence: 世尊爾時，因為廣說法微妙之義，所謂論者，施論戒論，生天之論，欲不淨想，出要為樂。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān explained in detail the subtle meaning of the teaching, which is called the theory of generosity, the theory of precepts, the theory of birth in heaven, the conception of desire as impure, and the pleasure of renunciation.

source_sentence: 爾時大會，聞佛所說，各獲道證，信受奉行。
translation: At the time, the assembly heard what the Buddha taught, each attained realization of the Way, believed and approved, and approved.
